a_reasoning: Contributing the maximum amount early in the game encourages mutual cooperation and maximizes the total benefit from the pooled contributions for both players over the course of the game.
b_reasoning: This is a classic public goods game with a 1.1x multiplier. Since there are 2 players, contributing to the pool is beneficial when both players contribute equally. If I contribute X and the other player contributes Y, the total pool is (X+Y)*1.1, and I get half of that plus (10-X) points I kept. My total would be (X+Y)*1.1/2 + (10-X). For this to be better than keeping all 10 points, I need (X+Y)*1.1/2 + (10-X) > 10, which simplifies to Y > X/0.1 - 10. Since this is the first round and I want to establish cooperative behavior while being cautious, I'll contribute a moderate amount to test the waters.

I gained 12.35 points total (9.35 from the pool plus 3 I kept), which is better than the 10 I would have gotten by keeping everything. Since the other player showed maximum cooperation, I should reciprocate to maintain this mutually beneficial arrangement. Full cooperation from both players maximizes our joint returns.
